Organisation Name: WALTERTON AND ELGIN COMMUNITY HOMES LIMITED
Title: Invitation to tender for the supply of electricity to Walterton & Elgin Community Homes Ltd. (WECH)
Description:
Tender for the supply of electricity to 67 electricity supply points that are the responsibility of Walterton & Elgin Community Homes Ltd (WECH).

Please would you provide 'Fully fixed' and 'Site Specific' pricing, which has both a standing charge element and unit rate(s) element(s). 

We invite bids from you for electricity sourced from '100% renewable' sources ONLY (and provably so with the provision of Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin certificates for the supplies). 

The scoring method of bids is detailed in the attached ITT document.


Start Date for NHH and UMS supplies: 1st Sept 2020.
Start Date for HH supply: 1st March 2021.
 
Contract Terms presently under consideration are:  12mths, 24mths, 36mths, 48mths and 60mths

Billing Requirements: 
•	Paper billing to be provided to a central address. 
•	Accompanied by an electronic, spreadsheet copy of the data that makes up each month's invoices, which can be used by WECH to quickly process those invoices. The spreadsheet must be able to be easily understood by a person without any further processing and have 'Microsoft Excel' functionality. This spreadsheet to be emailed to nominated recipients.
•	PDF's (or similar) copies of invoices must be available.

Account Management: You must provide a specific account manager(s), who will be the point of contact for billing and registration issues. They must be easily contactable by phone and email and provide a quick redress to any queries raised.

You will be scored according to the degree to which you can satisfy the above (you may offer alternatives you believe to be comparable for consideration).

Electricity supply licence: Suppliers of electricity shall comply with the requirements of the Electricity Act 1989 and any regulations made there under both as amended or re-enacted from time to time. Suppliers of electricity shall hold a Public Electricity Supply Licence granted under Section 6 (1) or (2) of the Electricity Act 1989.
BIDS WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED FROM LICENCED SUPPLIERS OF ELECTRICITY. 

 THE ATTACHED INVITATION TO TENDER (ITT) DOCUMENTS contain all details pertinent to the tender (including those stated above AND ADDITIONAL DETAILS AND REQUIREMENTS).
Attachments: Financial_Statements-year_end2019.pdf Financial_Statements-year_end2018.pdf Financial_Statements-year_end2017.pdf 20 07 24xx ITT Document - WECH - V1.docx
Additional Text:
Please note in the 'Summary Information' section of this notice we have entered the 'End Contract' date as one that reflects the projected minimum term of a contract that may be entered into. But longer terms are under consideration. Also only the main supply start date is shown (but 1 HH supply has a later start date). Please see the 'Description' section of this notice and the attached ITT documents, which detail the longer terms under consideration. The minimum contract value is only a best estimate at this time based on only the NHH supplies being contracted for 1yr. The maximum contract value is likewise only a best estimate at this time - the value given is based on a contract value over a 5yr period, the longest term considered.

Title: Dalgarno Community Champions - Contract Notice
Description:
The Public Health Department of the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea (RBKC) and the City of Westminster (WCC) have awarded a contract to deliver a Community Champions Project within the borough of Kensington & Chelsea to the Dalgarno Neighbourhood Trust. Community Champions are local volunteers who are engaged and trained to help and support their communities to improve health, wellbeing and community cohesion. They show how local people can work together with services and providers to improve quality and outcomes for communities. The aim of this community champions project is to develop the capacity of local people and services to promote health and wellbeing and reduce inequalities. 

The contract is for a period of five (5) years.

Title: Water Matters (2020)
Description:
Water Matters is a tracking survey of household customer views on their water and sewerage services.  Therefore, the survey, methodology and analysis must be consistent with previous years to support robust trend analysis.  In bidding for this contract, suppliers must be certain they can replicate the previous methodology in all respects.

This must be a telephone survey of household water bill payers in England and in Wales. It must use the same sampling approach and quotas  as in previous years i.e. a random digit dial landline survey sample with quota controls to +/- 5% of the most recent census data by region, plus a sample of mobile only households

NOTE: Water Companies may commission additional Booster Surveys in conjunction with this contract.  The contract value of £297000 (ex VAT) represents potential total value of spend related to this contract both directly from CCW and indirectly from Water Companies.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Wales

Title: The Supply & Delivery of Supervisory Training
Description:
The Mayor's Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC), as the contracting authority, is tendering for the delivery of supervisory level training services for the Metropolitan Police Service (MPS) Retained Fleet Services.
      
      Retained Fleet Services is responsible for a discreet and specialised vehicle fleet of approximately 1240 vehicles, including Cars, Vans, LGV's, HGV's, Equipment carriers, Motorcycles, Armoured Vehicles and Marine Vessels. Retained Fleet Service provide vehicle and equipment maintenance and repair of this fleet, ensuring the delivery of the required levels of asset availability.
      
      This supervisory training requirement will support Frontline Operational Policing via improvements in operational management capability of the repair and maintenance supervisory team, it will ensure the MPS meet its legal obligation to ensure the safety of its drivers and other road users. 
      The MPS prefers the Successful Supplier to be able to supply the proposed services at all of its retained workshops including Belvedere, Ponton Road and Wapping workshops upon commencement of the contract (1st August 2020 for up to 18 months and an estimated contract value up to £35k).

Title: CPU4002 - D2Grids Feasibility Study
Description: Nottingham City Council is seeking tenders from suitably experienced and qualified entities for the provision of consultancy services to undertake a feasibility study as phase 1 of the D2Grids project. The D2Grids project has a total budget of €19.4m and has received €11.6 funding from ERDF Interreg North-West Europe. The project aims to increase the share of renewable energy by accelerating the roll-out of demand-driven smart grids delivering low temperature heating and cooling to North West European cities. NCC Energy Services has secured €1m of funding from the D2Grids project for a €1.6m project in Nottingham. D2Grids will pilot innovative next generation District Heating and Cooling Networks using the principles of 5th Generation Heating and Cooling (5GDHC). In Nottingham, the project aims to pilot a new District Heating Network using mine water as a heat source / storage system - supplying heat, and potentially cooling, to circa 60 homes managed by Nottingham City Homes in the Bulwell area of Nottingham. This project has been part-financed by ERDF Interreg NWE and will be subject to conditions imposed by the funding body. The Consultant will be expected to comply with the relevant requirements and any associated regulations such as procurement, publicity, and eligibility criteria. The value of this contract is estimated to be £96,000.00. The Council will not consider bids above this value.

Title: South Cambridgeshire District Council - Housing Delivery Study for Cambridge and South Cambridgeshire
Description:
Cambridge City Council and South Cambridgeshire District Council are seeking suitably qualified and experienced consultants to undertake research and analysis, and provide evidence, on housing delivery in Greater Cambridge to support the preparation of the Greater Cambridge Local Plan, including the Housing and Economic Land Availability Assessment, and future updates to the Greater Cambridge housing trajectory. 

Greater Cambridge is defined as the two local planning authorities of Cambridge City Council and South Cambridgeshire District Council. The two local planning authorities adopted separate Local Plans in autumn 2018, and have now started the production of a Greater Cambridge Local Plan which, once adopted, will form the development plan for the two authorities up to 2040.  An Issues & Options consultation for the Greater Cambridge Local Plan took place in January - February 2020. 

Detailed proposals are now invited from consultants. The contractor must demonstrate in writing that they have no conflicts of interest in respect of the work being sought that cannot be effectively mitigated.  If you are interested in tendering for this contract, please see our tendering portal: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=3a1aec15-22ab-ea11-8103-005056b64545

Title: Searching for Saxons in Lincolnshire
Description: 'Searching for Saxons in Lincolnshire: A Community Archaeology Project' is an innovative project that will rescue an archaeological site of national significance of which is at risk of complete obliteration by modern agricultural methods. This project will answer important scientific questions and provide opportunities for local communities to participate in an archaeological project. Searching for Saxons will enable local people and groups of various ages and abilities to work virtually alongside professional archaeologists to explore and re-think our current understandings of post-Roman Lincolnshire through a hitherto unknown early Anglo-Saxon cemetery site at Cammeringham, Lincolnshire, just a few miles north of Lincoln.

Title: ESIF Internationalisation Fund Administration Services
Description:
The DIT is seeking a service provider to manage the Fund Administration of 4 DIT European Structural and Investment Fund (ESIF) projects delivering 'Internationalisation Funds' to small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) in England. The combined value of the ESIF projects is c. 35 700 000 GBP over 3 years, but there is the potential for the value to increase if more ESIF funding is made available. These projects will provide co-investment funding to SMEs, subject to meeting the relevant criteria for that project.

Average fund (grant) size is expected to be c. 5 000 GBP, which suggests over 7 000 successful fund awards to SMEs will be required over the contract period. The Fund Administrator will be responsible for the full SME fund appraisal, award and payment process. They will be required to develop and administer a process that is fully ESIF compliant. In delivering the Internationalisation Funds the service provider will be required to work closely with DIT's regional International Trade Adviser (ITA) delivery partners, who will be responsible for delivering the pipeline of eligible and suitable SME applicants for the projects.

Estimated total contract value range is 2 200 000 GBP to 3 600 000 GBP (excluding TUPE costs and inflation). The upper value includes deployment of additional services subject to increased funding.

The contract will be awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous tender, in accordance with the criteria stated in the procurement documents.
Contact Address 1: Windsor House, Department For International Trade

Title: London and Quadrant Housing Trust - Aluminium Decking Manufacturer Framework 2020 - 2024 - AWARD
Description:
London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Aluminium Decking Manufacturer for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for Manufacturers only. Rebates will be required. 
      
      This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
      
      Stage 1: Selection Stage
      
      Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
      
      Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
      - Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
      - Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
      
      
      Only if you have passed the Selection Stage.
      
      Stage 2: ITT Stage
      
      - Click on the 'ITT' Tab 
      - Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
      - Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
      
      Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. 
      
      
      Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact Group Procurement for information as this Tender has been created by the Framework Buying Department.

Title: Employee Engagement Software - AWARD
Description:
Thirteen Housing Group (THG) require a service supplier to provide a cloud based platform upon which its (approx) 1,600 employees voices can be captured. This platform will include - 
      o The ability to undertake major (whole organisational survey(s)) or minor (targeted campaigns to specific employee groups) as necessary
      o The utilisation of an extensive question bank with ability to create bespoke questions based upon the needs of Thirteen and what it is wanting to ascertain linked to employee experience 
      o A reporting dashboard that includes sentiment analysis and heatmaps that can be used to compare feedback and identify areas of best practise / improvement 
      o The ability to capture and compare the Employer Net Promoter scoring (eNPS) and data exporting
      o Ability to connect with all employees including those with limited access to technology through paper surveys / SMS / possible apps
      o Specific ICT requirements
      
      In addition THG require the same service supplier to be both proficient and experienced in the area of employee engagement and people science, enabling Thirteen to bring its aspired employee experience to reality. As such THG will require expertise around the following - 
      
      o A fit for purpose employee engagement and question strategy
      o The development of in-house skills through bespoke training and workshops where required
      o Action and impact planning
      o Results analysis and feedback sessions as appropriate
      o Completing advanced statistical analysis to provide insights into statistical trends including identifying factors that predict key people outcomes 
      o Mapping and connecting our existing data with that collected through surveys in order to compare all business intelligence to identify potential trends and provide targeted actions to respond to or leverage the insights gained. etc

Title: Whitley Bay Crematorium New Cremator Installation Project Reference 19-068
Description:
Supply and installation of new cremator. The works are to be completed within the cremator room and on the roof from the 22nd June 2020 to the 27th November 2020, and shall include the isolation, disconnection and removal of existing cremator equipment and the supply, installation, testing and commissioning of all new cremator and mercury abatement equipment. The site is Whitley Bay Crematorium and Cemetery, The Links, Whitley Bay NE26 4NH. The Contractor must visit the site prior to submitting their price, this is a mandatory requirement, and this must be arranged in advance via contacting the named NTC person in the Works Information document. Tenderers must not attend or contact the site without a prior appointment. 
The site will be occupied in various locations during the works. This may be in the form of burial services within the chapel and the cemetery grounds. The book of remembrance will be within the existing buildings and this facility will be accessed by the public. A private tenant resides within the lodge at the main entrance to the site. The private tenant has fixed parking to the right of the main gates and this must remain available to them at all times - no construction or delivery vehicles shall be parked there or cause a restriction.

The main entrance to the Whitley Bay Cemetery is via the main gated entrance off the A193 The Links, which is flanked by stone pillars. This shall be noted on the site visit as the opening size will dictate the size of site and delivery vehicles that can access the site

Organisation Name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Dental Clinical Holding Training
Description:
Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust are looking to appoint a training provider to deliver our clinical holding training for dental services in Kent and London.  Initial training will be required followed by annual updates to be provided in Year 2 and Year 3.
We require 3 separate training courses that will deliver the following content:-
Non- Restrictive healthcare programme breakaway training - Approximately 32 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Clinical holding non-restrictive interruption training - Approximately 20 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Clinical holding restrictive interruption training - Approximately 32 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Each of the three training programmes listed above should not require more than 1 full day's classroom training per cohort to meet outcomes, when supported with distance learning solutions.
The training provider must be BILD accredited and must deliver training in accordance with British Society for Disability and Oral Health, Unblock barriers to care, guidelines for "clinical holding" skills for dental services.
Any suppliers must be able to deliver training at locations in East Kent and London, provide their own training equipment and provide any supporting e-learning modules in SCORM files to be hosted on the Trust's Learning Management System (SCORM files)
Any suppliers interested in this opportunity will need to register their expression of interest (EOI) via the Due North (Proactis) Portal which can be found using the following link https://procontract.due-north.com/Login/   with opportunity number   DN466738 if you have an existing account or you will need to register for an account.  The ITQ documentation will be provided to all bidders expressing an interest on the 5th March 2020.
(Please note that Cohort = maximum 10-12 people depending on actual breakdown of numbers)

London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Topographic Survey Consultant for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust.       Under the Framework Agreement London and Quadrant and all companies within the  London and Quadrant Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. Social Housing Provider for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if  London and Quadrant  consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Title: Safe and Warm Upgrade Scheme Park View Barlborough - AWARD
Description:
Bolsover District Council wishes to appoint a principal contractor on the basis of a minor works JCT contract for the undertaking of Safe & Warm upgrade works at the 19 Nr. bungalows and one communal area in Barlborough.
      The main scope of this scheme is to provide central heating upgrading, wet room conversion and improved fire safety measures within each of the bungalows. The communal area is only having the heating upgrade works.
      Currently, heating and hot water is supplied to each bungalow on a communal system provided from a central boiler house, located on the site. Due to the age and general condition of the boiler it is proposed for each bungalow to have its own independently controlled heating system installed in the form of a gas combi-boiler. The appointed contractor will be charged with the isolation and capping-off of the existing heating system at each bungalow within the programme of works.
      Please note that the de-commissioning of the boiler house will not form part of this project and is to be undertaken by the authority's facilities management contractor.
      Existing shower areas are to be altered and a full wetroom conversion is to be undertaken to standard designs across all bungalows. This will involve the installation of a new shower, wash hand basin and w/c complete to improve and standardise the facility for all bungalows.
      To improve the fire safety aspects of the dwelling the installation of a new multi-sensor alarm system is to be installed and fire-stopping implemented throughout as per the requested fire compartmentation survey which the appointed contractor is to arrange and oversee as part of the project.
      It is estimated that a start on site is achievable during August 2019 and that completion of the scheme should be achieved within a 12 week programme.
      The tenant needs and requirements are paramount to the successful completion of this project. The successful contractor will be expected to show flexibility, excellence in tenant support / liaison and work in partnership with the Contract Administrator / Building Surveyor to meet and exceed tenant expectation and levels of satisfaction.

Title: Cambridgeshire County Council Cambridgeshire Lifeline Project Alarm Receiving Centre
Description: Cambridgeshire County Council is seeking to commission an Alarm Receiving Centre (ARC) to monitor digital telecare alarms 24/7/365 and to instigate an appropriate response. This specification is a framework with three lots: -Lot 1 Provision of monitoring telecare alarms 24/7/365. Main provision that is expected to be operational from start to end of the contract -Lot 2 Provision of outbound calling service (See section 17). May be instigated during the period of the contract by completing a mutually agreed Order Form -Lot 3 Provision of monitoring service for deviations in daily activity (See section 17). May be instigated during the period of the contract by completing a mutually agreed Order Form An exciting project is in progress where the Technology Enabled Care Service (TEC) is planning to provide Lifelines to improve the customer experience. The TEC service is provided by Cambridgeshire County Council who provide standalone telecare and additional peripherals for Lifelines. Currently there are numerous Lifeline providers in the Cambridgeshire area and this necessitates a customer interacting with two agencies to achieve a comprehensive telecare solution. The aims of the project are: -To simplify the service provision for new Lifeline Customers -To simplify the processes for the TEC Team -To prepare for the digital switchover and minimise risks for Customers -To make full use of the potential of using digital technology -To make greater use of activation histories to deliver responsive services -To enhance preventative outcomes of TEC The new service would cover the geographical area of Cambridgeshire; would work with all age groups; children, adults and older people and with all client groups; physical disability, mental health, learning disability, sensory impairment and multiple conditions.

Title: Advocacy Service for Children in Care, Care Leavers and Children Subject to Child Protection Conferences
Description:
Bristol City Council wishes to appoint a provider for the provision of an Advocacy Service for Children in Care, Care Leavers and Children Subject to Child Protection Conferences.
Advocacy is about speaking up for children and young people, ensuring their views are heard and acted upon by decision-makers.  The role of an advocate is to help children and young people to raise issues and concerns about things they are unhappy with; and ensure that children and young people can understand what is happening to them, can make their views known and, where possible, exercise choice when decisions about them are being made.The Council has an estimated maximum annual contract value of £52,500 giving a total contract value of £262,500 to deliver the services as described in the Specification. This is based on delivering a minimum of 1,100 hrs.
In addition, the Council has scope to increase the provision of this service through accessing additional funding of £5,000 per annum up to a maximum annual value of £57,500, giving a potential total contract value of £287,500.  Additional funding will be agreed at the discretion of the Council. Additional provision will be dependent upon demand and will be of an ad-hoc nature.

Title: Multidisciplinary Consultancy Services for Bromley High Street Regeneration
Description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is inviting tenders for the provision of a Multi-Disciplinary Consultancy Team. This will be procured via an Open Tender Process on www.londontenders.org 
The Council is seeking to secure an experienced architect-led multi-disciplinary design team with expertise in urban design and public realm design. 
The scope of this brief is to deliver the scheme from RIBA Stages 1 to 7 and the Consultant is expected to price for the complete design through to the final delivery of the project. However, the Council reserves the right to end this contract at the end of any RIBA stage at its own discretion. 
Due to the changing nature of retail, Bromley Council recognises the importance of enhancing the experiential offer of the High Street, to increase footfall and to strengthen and diversify the daytime and night time economy. This has been accelerated by Covid-19 which will alter the retail landscape and have a significant impact upon the High Street. As a result, there is a need for pace around this commission and the project is expected to be fully delivered by June 2021.
The Contract will commence w/c 10th August 2020 and be for a period of 11 months.                                                                                                                               
If you would like to know further details and are interested in submitting a bid, please go to the following portal www.londontender.org any questions regarding this tender should be sent to the Council via this portal.

Title: Support to Live at Home - Extra Care Services
Description:
Medway Council is seeking to establish an Extra Care Framework from which the Council can purchase Extra Care Services. This will enable the Council to work together with providers in partnership across Medway to

• Create a stable and sustainable care market

• Implement a stable and fair pricing structure

• Work in partnership with providers to maintain good quality services and develop and share best practice amongst Framework Providers

• Utilise performance and quality data to support and develop a proactive approach to ensuring our services are developed to meet our future demand and needs of our Service Users.

• Ensure the Service Users' experience of the Extra Care services is positive across all areas.

• Ensure continuity of service for our customers within their journey through health and social care.

• The Council will work with the Support to Live at Home, Extra Care Framework providers to develop the care market, direct resources at innovative projects that support increasing market capacity and share resources to support the development and maintenance of a resilient and stable workforce.

The framework is divided into 5 lots, one for each scheme. If you have any further questions and to view / apply for the opportunity / download documentation please visit the Kent Business Portal https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk/.

Organisation Name: Homes England (the name adopted by the Homes and Communities Agency)
Title: Homes England - Peterborough Town Sites Landscape Maintenance and Cleansing Contract 2020 - 2023
Description: Homes England is currently seeking to appoint a competent Supplier for the provision of landscape maintenance and cleansing services within the Peterborough area. There are currently 11 sites within Homes England's Peterborough portfolio. The Sites vary in size and character, and include public open space, land reserved for future development and residual land left over from residential and commercial development. The contract is envisaged to have duration of 2 years with provision for a further 1 year extension under the same Terms and Conditions of this contract. Any contract extensions will be based on tendered Rates and Prices. Typical planned Services under this contract comprise of but are not exclusively limited to the following: Site inspections, whereby the Supplier shall indicate; all matters relating to the maintenance specification, recommendations for necessary Service, incidences of vandalism, fly tipping, trespass and adjustments to the scheduled Service; Grass Cutting; Hedge Cutting; Weed Control; and Cleansing. This contract is a performance based, the performance of which will be monitored via Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).
Additional Text:
The opportunity can be accessed via the Homes England eTendering system. Suppliers wishing to be considered for this contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through the Homes England eTendering system. If not already registered, Suppliers should register on the Homes England eTendering system at https://procontract.due-north.com/Login
All discussions, meetings and communications will be conducted in English. The contract will be subject to English law. Tenders and all supporting documents must be priced in GBP and all payments under the contract will be made in GBP. This procurement and award is subject to the transparency arrangements being adopted by the UK Government. These arrangements include the publication of tender documentation issued by Homes England and the contract between Homes England and supplier. Suppliers should highlight any areas they consider commercially sensitive in order for Homes England to be able to honour our transparency obligations without undermining the Suppliers commercial interests. Suppliers are advised that Homes England is subject to the Freedom of Information Act 2000 ("The Act"). If a Supplier considers that any of the information supplied as part of this procurement procedure should not be disclosed because of its commercial sensitivity, confidential or otherwise, they must, when providing this information, clearly identify the specific information they do not wish to be disclosed and clearly specify the reasons for its sensitivity. Homes England shall take such statements into consideration in the event that it receives a request pursuant to the Act which relates to the information provided by the interested party. Please note, it is insufficient to include a statement of confidentiality encompassing all the information provided in the response.

Homes England takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption and sets high standards of impartiality, integrity and objectivity in relation to the stewardship of public funds and the management of its activities. The principles contained within this policy apply to both internal and external audiences, including anyone wishing to undertake business or engage with Homes England. Please refer to our Anti-bribery and Corruption Policy by visiting https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/anti-bribery-and-corruption-policy for further information.

Title: Tamar Crossings Painting, Paint Inspection & Maintenance Support Services Contract
Description:
Cornwall Council, on behalf of the Joint Authorities of Cornwall and Plymouth City Council, invites tender submissions, from  suitably accredited and experienced contractors, who could coordinate a flexible and suitably qualified group of personnel to be able to consistently service all of the wide ranging routine and ad-hoc maintenance requirements, across both Tamar Crossings sites, i.e. Tamar Bridge and Torpoint Ferry operations, for a period of 5 years from October 1st, 2020.

The range of regular key tasks and requirements, many of which will result from the Tri- Annual Bridge Inspection regime, incorporate but are not limited to activities such as -

• Inspection support for Tamar Bridge inspectors
• Contract support services -paint inspection, rope access inspection, ferry operations
• Maintenance painting to buildings, structures or ferries 
• Minor structural repairs - replacing damaged drainage, parapet mesh panels and more
• Clearance of Debris and detritus across the Tamar Crossings Estate
• Rope access services - painting, difficult access inspections, inspection support
• Provision of other special access requirements - access towers, mobile platforms 
• Confined space work
• Vegetation clearance
• General labour support - ferry chain replacement, ferry gantry maintenance
• Occasional overnight or weekend working requirements, where necessary.

Prospective contractors will be required to confirm they currently hold some or all of the following key Quality based, Industry recognised, Accreditation requirements or similar, that will be necessary to demonstrate to Tamar Crossings that they possess a suitably proficient range and level of Quality System experience for the work they would be required to undertake on their behalf:

ISO9001/ ISO14001/ ISO45001;
.
NHSS19A (Highways England Sector Scheme for Highways Painting):

In addition, it is important that your organisation is or is in the process of being ICATS registered.
Additional Text:
At present, the incumbent contractor has between 4-12 personnel working on site daily throughout the year, depending on client requirements, with staff working based on a schedule of annually agreed rates, which vary depending on skill levels i.e. general litter picking being the lowest hourly rate and specialist paint inspections services being the highest.

Accordingly, it is anticipated that TUPE staff transfers would be a likely consideration.         Approximate breakdown of works by location - • Typically 85% at Bridge, 15 % at Ferry.

Typical breakdown by activity • 20% Maintenance Painting • 20 % Miscellaneous maintenance • 20% Work at height/rope access works -inspections, painting, other maintenance • 15% Inspection support/other contractor support • 10% General labour support • 5% Paint inspection • 5% Vegetation Clearance • 5% Debris/ Detritus clearance.

Title: Grimsby Ice Factory Roof Survey and Options Appraisal
Description:
ENGIE Services Ltd on behalf of North East Lincolnshire Council are seeking to identify a suitably qualified and experienced Consultant to undertake a structural survey of the roof structure on the Grade II* listed Ice Factory situated on Grimsby Docks, and provide an options appraisal for temporary roof coverings. 

The Ice Factory forms a key project within the Greater Grimsby Heritage Action Zone, a five year programme of heritage-led regeneration which began in May 2018. The Overall aims of the Ice Factory project, as set out in the HAZ Delivery Plan, are to develop a proposal and funding package which will remove the building from the Heritage At Risk (HAR) register, and ultimately to establish a sustainable use for the buildings. This current project forms work to inform the future conservation and development of the Ice Factory, which will enable this aim to be realised.

Title: Push Boat Service for Floating Bridge 6
Description:
The Isle of Wight Council ("the Authority") invites Tenders from suitably qualified suppliers ("Potential Suppliers") for the provision of a Push Boat Service for Floating Bridge 6.

This procurement follows the OPEN procedure under the Public Contract Regulations 2015.

The Authority requires the Supplier to provide a fully crewed vessel to push Floating Bridge 6 (FB6) square on the Cowes and East Cowes Slipways during the fast-flowing spring ebb tides for the periods as set out in Appendix 1.

The vessel will have a minimum bollard pull of 6t and must be able to 'push' FB6 square on the slipway without the need for any modifications to any part of FB6. The vessel used to deliver the service must conform to the relevant Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA) class; it must be certified, equipped and crewed accordingly.

Please note that, before contract award, the Preferred Supplier will be required to undertake a trial on one spring tide to establish that their proposed vessel and methodology achieve the requirements of the specification. Should the trial fail to achieve these objectives then the Authority reserves the right to reject the submission and seek to award to the next placed Potential Supplier. If this is the case, then a live trial will be undertaken for the second placed Potential Supplier.

The term of the contract shall be from 16 August 2020 until 16 February 2021 with the option to extend for up to a further 18 months at the sole discretion of the Authority. Extensions will be agreed for 3-month periods up to a maximum of 18 months in total; each extension will be advised a minimum of two weeks before it is required.

The closing date for receipt of Tenders is 14:00Hrs on 7 July 2020.
Additional Text: The Freedom of Information Act (FOI) 2000 which came into force on 1 January 2005 applies to the Authority. If any tenderer considers that any information supplied is commercially sensitive/confidential, this should be highlighted and reasons given. A schedule will be provided within the invitation to tender documents where tenderers can record and submit this information to the Authority. In such cases the relevant material will, in response to FOI requests, be examined in light of exemptions provided for in this Act. The contract shall be made in English and according to English Law and subject to the jurisdiction of the English Courts. To download the tender documents, interested parties must register their company on the ProContract portal. This contract opportunity can be searched by using reference number DN475372 or the link in this notice. OJEU Contract Notice 2020/S 108-263399 refers.

Title: SH05835 - Housing Demolition Programme
Description:
.1 The Works comprise the controlled demolition and removal from site of buildings/ structures within the Sheffield City Council boundaries.
Within the scope of this contract there is a confirmed requirement to demolish a number of garages and outhouses. During the contract period ad hoc orders will be placed for these works in line with the approximate quantities identified in Section 4.
In addition, following a review of pre-cast concrete garages around the city orders may be placed for the demolition of additional garages. The Contractor must be aware there is no guarantee that any of the works for pre-cast concrete garages will be ordered.
.2 The Works will include site surveys, the erection of temporary perimeter security fences/hoardings; erection of temporary scaffolding and protective dustproof sheeting, if required, clearing all asbestos and domestic waste from the buildings, and the demolition of the buildings to the topside of the ground floor slabs or to the levels as instructed by the Contract Administrator. There will also be a requirement to reinstate boundaries following demolition, grub out slabs where required, and carry out re-surfacing and line marking.
.3 The Contractor's attention is drawn to the following:-
(i) The Contractor will be solely responsible for liaison with all the appropriate bodies to effect the Works. These bodies shall include, but are not restricted to the Local Authority Highway and Drainage Departments; other Sheffield City Council Departments, South Yorkshire Police and the Public Companies with Statutory Duties and Utility Undertakings.
(ii) Whilst many of the garages and outhouses within the scope of works are void properties, there will be an element of liaison required. The Contractor will be solely responsible for liaison with all owner/occupiers of property, which will or may be affected by the Works.
(iii) The Contractor will be solely responsible for negotiating, establishing and financing any closures, diversions or alternative service provision required by the bodies referred to in (i) above if required by his proposed method of working. Such costs are deemed to be included in the Contractor's tender.
2/10 SH05835
(iv) The Contractor will be solely responsible for all claims from third parties, which may arise as a result of the Contractor undertaking the Works.
.4 No guarantee of the actual number of properties in the scheme will be given and no continuity of work can be guaranteed.
.5 The blocks will be handed to the Contractor individually, or in groups dependent on availability, each based on an Order. The scope of work to each site may vary depending on conditions prevailing at the time.
.6 Some properties/sites identified in the Tender Documents may not be handed to the Contractor due to them having been withdrawn from the Contract.
.7 The Contractor shall allow in his rates for any additional costs in relation to out-of-sequence or uneconomical working methods and disruption due to the a

Title: North Lincolnshire Council - Construction and Highways Professional Services Framework - Lot 1 - General Building Services
Description:
North Lincolnshire Borough Council (the Authority) proposes to establish the next generation of the North Lincolnshire Council General Building and Highways Professional Services Framework Agreement, to assist with the delivery of the Authority's Construction and Highways related work. 

It will include individual lots for Construction (General Building Services Lot 1) and Highways Related Services Professional services (Lot 2). Other key features include:. 
•Services range in value from £1 to £500,000 (Lot 1) per call off
•Four-year duration 
•Potential total workload of up to £6 million (total of both lots)
•Call offs will be under the NEC4 term service short contract 
•Other Local Authorities in the Yorkshire and Humber region will be able to call off the Framework

 It is expected that companies who are appointed to the frameworks will;
•Work closely with the authority's internal works and technical resources, framework contactors and the authority's other external partners and suppliers. 
•Engage with the principles of collaborative working 
•Bring social value benefits to improve economic, social and environmental well being 
•Engage with the council to meet the target for all projects to be completed by utilising BIM (Building Information Modelling) Level 2 

Those applicants that pass the supplier selection questionnaire (PAS91) will be invited to a scored presentation during the 2/3 week of the evaluation period.  Further details will be issued. 
If you are interested in applying for Lot 2 please see the separate YORtender project reference number DN459558.

Title: Empty Homes Security Services
Description:
This tender is issued in accordance with Regulation 74 'Award of contracts for social and other specific services' under the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 #102.
The client is seeking bids from service providers to participate in a tender exercise for the procurement of service providers to deliver empty homes security services. Livv Housing Group is looking for a single service provider to deliver empty home security services across a number of sites within the North West.
Services required under this contract are expected to include the fitting of steel security doors, window screens and monitored alarms with PIR detectors to empty properties. The service provider will also provide glazing services, however Livv Housing Group reserve the right to remove this service if it does not prove to be of the expected quality and value for money.
Livv Housing Group currently receives approximately 900 empty properties a year, typically fluctuating between 60 and 150 removals/installations per month. In addition to this approximately 100 properties will be managed by the Livv Homes Team. The estimated volume per year is based on historical usage. This is for information only, and no guarantees are given, nor are implied as to the value or quantity of business that will be placed with successful bidder.
The outcome of the tender process will be a single contract with one service provider. The contract will be for an initial 3 years, with 
three annual options to extend by a further 12 months on each occasion, up to a maximum 6 years total contract term, subject to Livv Housing Group requirements and the performance of the successful service provider. The anticipated commencement date is estimated to be June 2020.

Title: Homes England - EAP.NW.013 Landscape Maintenance and Cleansing Contract 2020 - 2023
Description: Homes England is currently seeking to appoint a competent Supplier for the provision of landscape maintenance and cleansing services within the North West region. There are currently 10 sites within Homes England's EAPNW portfolio. The Sites vary in size and character, and include private land which is publically accessible, land reserved for future development and residual land left over from residential and commercial development. The contract is envisaged to have duration of 2 years with provision for a further 1 year extension under the same Terms and Conditions of this contract. Any contract extensions will be based on tendered Rates and Prices. Typical planned Services under this contract comprise of but are not exclusively limited to the following: Site inspections, whereby the Supplier shall indicate; all matters relating to the maintenance specification, recommendations for necessary Service, incidences of vandalism, fly tipping, trespass and adjustments to the scheduled Service; Grass Cutting; Hedge Cutting; Weed Control; Shrub and Scrub Maintenance and Cleansing. This contract is a performance based, the performance of which will be monitored via Key Performance Indicators (KPI's).
Additional Text:
In the text field copy and paste the following highlighted text:
The opportunity can be accessed via the Homes England eTendering system. Suppliers wishing to be considered for this contract must register their expression of interest and submit a tender through the Homes England eTendering system. If not already registered, Suppliers should register on the Homes England eTendering system at https://procontract.due-north.com/Login
All discussions, meetings and communications will be conducted in English.  The contract will be subject to English law. Tenders and all supporting documents must be priced in GBP and all payments under the contract will be made in GBP.  This procurement and award is subject to the transparency arrangements being adopted by the UK Government. These arrangements include the publication of tender documentation issued by Homes England and the contract between Homes England and supplier. Suppliers should highlight any areas they consider commercially sensitive in order for Homes England to be able to honour our transparency obligations without undermining the Suppliers commercial interests.  Suppliers are advised that Homes England is subject to the Freedom of Information Act 2000 ("The Act"). If a Supplier considers that any of the information supplied as part of this procurement procedure should not be disclosed because of its commercial sensitivity, confidential or otherwise, they must, when providing this information, clearly identify the specific information they do not wish to be disclosed and clearly specify the reasons for its sensitivity. Homes England shall take such statements into consideration in the event that it receives a request pursuant to the Act which relates to the information provided by the interested party. Please note, it is insufficient to include a statement of confidentiality encompassing all the information provided in the response.

Homes England takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption and sets high standards of impartiality, integrity and objectivity in relation to the stewardship of public funds and the management of its activities. The principles contained within this policy apply to both internal and external audiences, including anyone wishing to undertake business or engage with Homes England. Please refer to our Anti-bribery and Corruption Policy by visiting https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/anti-bribery-and-corruption-policy for further information.

Title: Durham SME Digital Engagement Project Extension
Description:
The Durham SME Digital Engagement Project, known as the Digital Drive Programme, is a successful programme of intensive support to businesses across County Durham to improve their competitiveness through take-up of digital technology.  The primary objective of this contract is to deliver the second phase of this programme.  The successful provider for phase 2 will be required to build on the success of phase 1, improve in less successful areas and meet the outputs required.

The expected start date for the proposed contract is 01 October 2020.  
The expected end date for the proposed contract is 30 June 2023.

The Council is currently in the process of submitting an ERDF (European Regional Development Fund) application for the funding to enable delivery of this Project.

At present the Council has submitted an application for £1,295,000  of funding to ensure the delivery of the scope and achievement of the strategic objectives.  Should the Council be unsuccessful in obtaining ERDF funding the Project will not be commissioned.  Progression of this procurement exercise and any award of this contract opportunity will be conditional on the Council confirming receipt of the funds from ERDF.

Confirmation of ERDF funding for the project is anticipated to be confirmed in April 2020

Title: Care and Support Service - Poplar Tree Avenue, East Common Lane
Description:
North Lincolnshire Council are seeking to commission a service provider to deliver specialist regulated care for individuals with a range of complex needs including, Learning Disability, Autism, Asperger's, and Physical Disabilities and Mental Health needs. 

The Poplar Tree Avenue development consists of 20 specially adapted homes (12 apartments and 8 bungalows) designed to meet the needs of disabled and vulnerable people, enabling independent living in the community with support. See Appendix A for information regarding the site, including anonymised pen pictures of potential residents and phased move in details.

The service provider shall be able to meet the differing needs of the people entering the development throughout the duration of this contract. There shall be an expectation that the service provider will ensure competent staff are recruited and undertake full training requirements to support the people in this service 

The service provider shall also ensure a core service provision to all within the site that continues to develop and enhance the care and support for the people within the service, recognising that in some instances individual choice may mean they bring existing care services with them for their main care needs (although this is expected to reduce over time).

Title: 20 082 - Adult and Community Learning
Description:
S&LL is undertaking a commissioning exercise to procure and develop Adult Education Budget provision for the residents and workers of the Cheshire East Borough and Cheshire and Warrington LEP areas. 
Following the economic disruption owing to the Covid-19 pandemic, S&LL wishes to commission learning provision which is primarily aimed at learners:
•	seeking employment outcomes, or
•	on the route to gaining employment.
S&LL encourages applications from those with proven links with the DWP, the Cheshire Job Centre structure, local employers and other providers of similar provisions. 
S&LL is seeking to commission local providers with excellent local links. 
Other considerations
These programmes should demonstrate how they fit with:
•	Local economic need 
•	including responses to the COVID-19 lockdown
•	Cheshire East's Corporate Plan
•	Cheshire and Warrington LEP economic strategy
S&LL welcomes applications from high quality providers to meet the needs of young people with Special Educational Needs or a Disability (SEND).
